channel.title: How to make a picture taker?
channel.description: i need a script that will secretly take pictures and store them on my flash drive. I need to see who has been on my computer and what they have been doing. So in summary i need a script that takes pictures and stores them.

item.title: How to make a picture taker?
item.dc:creator: @dave5534 dave5534
item.description:
@dave5534 wrote:

You could use a keylogger, it’s not a picture taker but it would tell you what websites some ones been to and what they typed. Kane’s keylogger is a good exsample.

item.source: How to make a picture taker?

item.title: How to make a picture taker?
item.dc:creator: @Weibs Weibs
item.description:
@Weibs wrote:

Ok, I made one.

There’s a form for the setup, which is explained below, but first, when you open the script, there’s a const that has //SETUP above and below it.

Set that to your preferences, if you set it to true, it will hide the scar window while the script is running.

On the form, the first box that is labeled File Path To Save Pics just put the directory path that you want to save the pictures in.

For example, you could save them in your My Pictures folder by putting this:

C:\Documents and Settings\User Here\My Documents\My Pictures\ScreenWatcher

Or anywhere else you want to save it.

Then, for the BMP File Name, this is just what will be put in each picture’s file name. For example, if you put ScreenWatcherBMP then the saved pictures would show up like this:

ScreenWatcherBMP_0.bmp, ScreenWatcherBMP_1.bmp, etc.

Then for the seconds inbetween pictures, well, thats self-explanatory.

Also, there’s a button that says Clear Pic Num which means to start the picture count over, because it saves this number for future use, but you may delete some pictures, so you can reset it.

Then click submit, and whenever you want to stop the script, just hold down F12 for about a second.

-Weibs.

EDIT: Look 6 posts down for a version with seconds instead of minutes.

Read full topic

item.title: How to make a picture taker?
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

Run this in scar:

[php]
begin
repeat
if IsFKeyDown(5) then
begin
SaveScreenshot(AppPath + ‘Screenshot’ + IntToStr(Random(500000) + 1000) + ‘.bmp’);
wait(500); // Simply to stop 2+ screenies
end;
until ISFKeyDown(2);
end.
[/php]

F5 to take a screenshot, F2 to stop. Pictures are saved to C:\Program Files\SCAR 2.03\

WARNING: F5 refreshes on FireFox/Internet Explorer!!

Read full topic

item.title: How to make a picture taker?
item.dc:creator: @Ron Ron
item.description:
@Ron wrote:

Try this screenshot taker. Run the script and press F12 to take screenshots.

Edit: Sorry, I forgot to post code. 

{ Ron's ScreenShot Taker just for Codester93          ]
[ Run the program and press F12 to take a screenshot. }

program ScreenShotTakerByRon;
var
  i : integer;
begin
  ClearDebug;
  repeat
    i := i + 1;
    repeat
      wait(100);
    until(isfkeydown(12))
    SaveScreenshot(AppPath+'\'+IntToStr(i)+'.bmp');
    WriteLn('Saved screenshot to: '+AppPath+IntToStr(i)+'.bmp');
    repeat
      wait(100);
    until(not(isfkeydown(12)))
  until(isfkeydown(11))
end.

Read full topic
